Package view

Class YourOrderController

java.lang.Object
view.YourOrderController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class YourOrderController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
YourOrderController class handles inputs from the your order GUI and defines all actions and helper methods relating to events triggered by the GUI

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private javafx.scene.control.ListView<java.lang.String> myOrder  
    private javafx.scene.control.Button placeOrderBtn  
    private javafx.scene.control.Button removeItemBtn  
    private static double SALES_TAX_PERCENT  
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField salestax  
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField totalTextField  
    (package private) Order yourOrder  
    private javafx.scene.control.TextField yourOrderSubtotal  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    YourOrderController()
    default constructor for YourOrderController, initializes yourOrder to be the current Order and adds a listener to ensure that subtotalinfo, salestax, and total are changes whenever the order is changed

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void calculatesalestax()
    calculates sales tax for order and updates textfield
    private void calculatetotal()
    calculates order total and updates textfield
    static void displayAlert​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String message)
    displays an alert message with a title and messages
    void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
    dictates actions right after your order GUI is created
    void loadOrderInfo()
    populates the listview with appropriate order details
    void loadStoreOrders()
    handles action when user wants to add their order to the Store Orders
    void loadSubtotalInfo()
    populates the subtotal textfield with appropriate subtotal amount
    private void removeItem()
    removes a menuitem from your order
    static java.lang.String RoundTo2Decimals​(double val)
    returns a formatted String to 2 decimal places given a double
